channel.title: Home on AetherAI
channel.description: Recent content in Home on AetherAI

item.title: About Us
item.description: EleutherAI (/iˈluθər eɪ. aɪ/) is a decentralized collective of volunteer researchers, engineers, and developers focused on AI alignment, scaling, and open source AI research. Founded in July of 2020, we are most well known for our ongoing efforts to build and open source large language models, but we also do open research in alignment, interpretability, BioML, ML art and many other fields. Our Discord server is open and welcomes contributors!

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.description: The official EleutherAI FAQ, covering every question you probably have about EleutherAI.

item.title: GPT-NeoX
item.description: Announcing GPT-NeoX-20B, a 20 billion parameter model trained in collaboration with CoreWeave.

item.title: Get Involved
item.description: Joining EleutherAI is as simple as joining us on Discord and picking a project to contribute to. As an independent organization, we are dependent upon donations to power our compute. If you have a very large quantity of compute or compute credits, please contact us directly at contact[at]eleuther.ai Contributors are traditionally expected to have at some experience with machine learning and data science. While there is some work for people without that skillset, we are a DL research lab and therefore most work involves writing, training, and inferencing neural networks with industry-standard frameworks.

item.title: GPT-J
item.description: GPT-J-6B, a 6 billion parameter model trained on the Pile, is now available for use with our new codebase, Mesh Transformer JAX.

item.title: Blog
item.description: We believe the creation and open source release of a large language model is a net good to AI safety. We explain why.

item.title: Blog
item.description: Rotary Positional Embedding (RoPE) is a new type of position encoding that unifies absolute and relative approaches. We put it to the test.

item.title: GPT-Neo
item.description: GPT-Neo 1.3B and 2.7B are now available on Hugging Face Model Hub! Run the models with Transformers or call for them through their on-demand Inference API.

item.title: GPT-Neo
item.description: GPT-Neo 1.3B and 2.7B, trained on the Pile, are now available to run with the GPT-Neo framework.

item.title: The Pile
item.description: We are proud to announce the release of the Pile, a free and publicly available 825GB dataset of diverse English text for language modeling!

item.title: AlphaFold2 Replication
item.description: A replication of AlphaFold2 architecture (very accurate protein structure prediction model) with a free licensing.

item.title: YAKbot
item.description: A complex, multipurpose AI Discord bot.
